alert.note: Alert for Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:31PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson County through 500 PM MDT... At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Mt Zirkel, or 47 miles northeast of Craig, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake John and Pearl. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
